detailed_summary: The abstract presents a study that aims to derive a formula involving Young diagrams to identify the minimum positive integer d such that q(d) is found within the quantum product of two Schubert classes in the submaximal isotropic Grassmannians, specifically in types B and C. The authors employ the technique of studying curve neighborhoods to achieve this goal. They compute these neighborhoods across various combinatorial models, including k-strict partitions and partitions that align with the Bruhat order. This research contributes to the understanding of the interplay between combinatorial structures and algebraic geometry within the specified mathematical frameworks.
